title: The moste excellent and pleasaunt booke, entituled: The treasurie of Amadis of Fraunce conteyning eloquente orations, pythie epistles, learned letters, and feruent complayntes, seruing for sundrie purposes. ... Translated out of Frenche into English.
author: Paynell, Thomas.
publisher: By Henry Bynneman, for Thomas Hacket. And are to be solde at his shoppe in the Royall Exchaunge. at the signe of the greene Dragon,
notes: A selection translated by Thomas Paynell from "Le tresor de Amadis", in turn a selection from books 1-13 of Nicolas de Herberay's translation of "Amadis de Gaula".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
